page.title: 03Transport in Bramley area.
page.content: In Hellaby there is an M18 junction with the A631 which links up{a major {motorway network.}It links with the M1 and M62 to London, Leeds, Doncaster, Hull, Manchester and also Liverpool. {The M1_M18 link was completed in 1969. The A631 goes to Rotherham and Sheffield to the west, and Bawtry, Gainsborough and the east coast to the east. It is a very busy dual carriageway on the Rotherham side. { These excellent road links account {for the rapid growth of our area. There is also sufficient{Public {Transport}in this area, in the way of busses. These service all the shopping areas. The busses that go on these routes are the 102,101,104,18,19 and the 287 to Sheffield. 62% of people regularly use busses: 70% own cars. The local mineral railway is closed, its bridges and track removed.
